subject: ATTENTION!!!
body:
ATTENTION!!!
My Name is Andrew J Savage , III, Senior Storage officer at Charleston
International Airport (CHS) SC USA.
During our recent withheld package routine check at the Airport
Storage Vault, we had discovered an abandoned shipment from one
Diplomat agent,under shipping forwarder from Hatfield-Jackson Atlanta
Intl Airport to our facility custody here in Charleston International
Airport SC and when scanned, it revealed an undisclosed sum of money
in one Metal Trunk Box.
The consignment was abandoned because the Contents of the consignment
was not properly declared by the consignee as MONEY rather it was
declared as personal effect to avoid diversion by the shipping agent
or inability of the diplomat to pay for United States Inspection
charges.
Warmest Regards,
Mr. Andrew J Savage ,
III, the Senior Storage officer
at Charleston International Airport SC

subject: Re:   ATTENTION!!!
body:
Hello Mr. Andrew Savage III,

Thank you for reaching out to me with this information. It sounds quite interesting. Could you please provide me with more details about the abandoned shipment? I'm curious to know how much money was found in the metal trunk box and what will happen to it now that it has been discovered.

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: ATTENTION!!!
body:
Dear Richard,

During our recent withheld package routine check at the Airport Storage
Vault, we had  discovered an abandoned shipment from one Diplomat agent,
under shipping forwarder from Hatfield-Jackson Atlanta Intl Airport to
our Facility custody here in Charleston International Airport SC and when
scanned, it revealed an undisclosed sum of money in one Metal Trunk Box.

The consignment was abandoned because the Contents of the consignment
was not properly declared by the consignee as MONEY rather it was declared
as personal effect to avoid diversion by the shipping agent  or inability
of the diplomat to pay for United States Inspection charges.

The details of the consignment including your name and email address only
and in addition your funds is worth $44,000,000,00 Million Dollars in

Note: Everything has been taken care of, including Taxes, Custom paper and
Clearance Duty. File the information below and get back to us with the
payment of $3,500.00 Only.

Your Full Name:_________________
Your House Address:_______________ Home/Cell/Phone Number:_______________
DL ID:________________
Nearest Airport:_________________
Occupation:___________
Email Address:_____________

Be advised that this is the only delay we have now and you must do what you
can to comply with the fee so that we can get this done.

We are so sure of everything and we are giving you a 100% Money back
Guarantee if you do not receive payment/package within the next 48hrs after
you have made the payment for Shipping then the payment will return back to
you immediately until your received your funds.

Yours Sincerely
Andrew J. Savage
Senior Storage Officer?

subject: Re: ATTENTION!!!
body:
Dear Andrew,

Thank you for reaching out to me with this information. I must admit, it sounds quite intriguing. Could you please provide me with more details about the abandoned shipment? I'm curious to know how such a large sum of money ended up in a metal trunk box and why it was not properly declared.

Additionally, could you clarify what you mean by "Clearance Duty" and the payment of Only? I want to make sure I understand the process correctly before proceeding.

Looking forward to your response.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: ATTENTION!!!
body:
Dear Richard,

The consignment was abandoned because the Contents of the consignment
was not properly declared by the consignee as MONEY rather it was declared
as personal effect to avoid diversion by the shipping agent. Your fund is
kept safe in the metal trunk box. The agent inability to pay for United
States Inspection charges and the clearance Duty as well and the $3,500,00
Dollars only?

Yours Sincerely
Andrew Savage?

subject: Re: ATTENTION!!!
body:
Dear Andrew Savage,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I appreciate you sharing this information with me. Can you please provide more details about the abandoned shipment? How did it end up being declared as personal effects instead of money? And why was there a need to avoid diversion by the shipping agent?

I'm also curious about the United States Inspection charges and clearance duty that the agent couldn't pay. Could you explain what those charges are for and why they were necessary in this case?

Lastly, I noticed you mentioned that the fund is kept safe in a metal trunk box. Can you tell me more about how it is being stored and who has custody of it at the moment?

Thank you again for sharing this information with me. I look forward to hearing back from you.

Best wishes,
Richard

subject: Re: ATTENTION!!!
body:
Dear Richard,

It’s was declared as personal effects because the delivery agent must not
know what’s in the box for security reasons.

When shipments arrive at the airport of entry in the United States, they
are subject to inspection by U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP).
During this process, officers from the airport, CBP, inspect the documents
associated with the shipment to ensure that all required information is
present and accurate fee of $3,500,00 Dollars.

I am the senior storage officer and your fund is under my custody and safe.

Yours Sincerely
Andrew J. Savage?

subject: Re: ATTENTION!!!
body:
Dear Andrew J. Savage,

Thank you for reaching out to me and providing this information. I appreciate your explanation regarding the declaration of personal effects for security reasons. It's interesting to learn about the inspection process by Customs and Border Protection in the United States.

Could you please clarify what documents are required for the shipment? And what is the purpose of the fee of Dollars that you mentioned?

Also, I would like to know more about how my fund ended up under your custody and how it is being kept safe. Can you provide some details on that?

Thank you again for sharing this information with me.

Best wishes,
Richard
